item.description:

item.title: Rubbish repeatedly dumped on street, 19th October
item.description:
There is rubbish repeatedly dumped on the street at this end of the road from the flats. The developer was given permission to build more flats on the grounds they sort the way rubbish is stored. Clearly they aren't doing this

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mackenzie Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: More and more garbage is appearing, 19th October
item.description:
More and more garbage has been appearing outside numbers 56–62 almost every day. How can the council neglect this issue and allow it to keep happening? It’s becoming a very serious sanitation problem. Why are residents allowed to dump rubbish directly on the street without using bins? These piles of waste are seriously affecting the entire block.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 69, Charlton Church Lane, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Burnt out Volvo, 19th October
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 58,60, Friary Road, North Finchley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There are piles of garbage and fly-tipping, 19th October
item.description:
There are piles of garbage and fly-tipping in this corner recently. It keeps getting worse, with more rubbish being dumped each time. Could the council please find out who is responsible for this and fine them?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Nadine Street, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Parking in double yellow lines., 19th October
item.description:
Th user of this vehicle parks on double yellow lines, blocking the exit of vehicles parked in the designated area.This behavior has been occurring for several weeks, and the driver of this vehicle appears to have no respect for other road users.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mill Row, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
